page.title: 14Bass Museum of Brewing
page.content: Bass Museum stands on the corner of Guild Street. It is famous around the country for its history of brewing and models. As you arrive in the museum you watch a film about the olden days and the way beer used to be made. On a shelf there are ingredients - hops,barley and a bowl of water. There is one particular model shows the old Burton where there used to be a lot of fields and farms. Also there is a model of a ship carrying beer barrels. Making barrels was very important. In the shopping precint there is a statue of a cooper showing this. To make a barrel you need about ten pieces of wood then to keep them together you need metal rings all the way round. Most beer today is contained in metal kegs, and there are very few coopers left in the breweries.
